entry.title: The Most Difficult Part of Requirements Gathering Is Not the Act of Recording What the Users Want; It Is the Exploratory, Developmental Activity of Helping Users Figure Out What They Want.
entry.content: “The most difficult part of requirements gathering is not the act of recording what the users want; it is the exploratory, developmental activity of helping users figure out what they want.” – Steve C McConnell

entry.title: Good Specifications Will Always Improve Programmer Productivity Far Better Than Any Programming Tool or Technique.
entry.content: “Good specifications will always improve programmer productivity far better than any programming tool or technique.” – Milt Bryce

entry.title: A Program Which Perfectly Meets a Lousy Specification Is a Lousy Program.
entry.content: “A program which perfectly meets a lousy specification is a lousy program.” – Cem Kaner
